intro: Tricholepis roylei, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 2,500 and 4,500 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Tricholepis roylei is often found in open meadows and is a subject of interest for botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
